title: Network Administrator/Hardware Engineer NEW!
full_description: Network Administrator/Hardware Engineer Responsibilities• Fully supporting, configuring, maintaining, and upgrading corporate PC’s/Macs, networks, and in-house servers• Installing and integrating new server hardware and applications• Keeping all devices updated with software/hardware patchesJob briefWe are looking for a Network Administrator/Hardware Engineer to assist with maintaining a reliable, secure, and efficient data communications network, as well as maintaining all internal hardware. The ideal candidate will be able to deploy, configure, maintain, and monitor all in house technology and networks.Responsibilities• Fully support, configure, maintain and upgrade corporate customer’s networks and in house servers• Install and integrate new server hardware and applications• Keeping all devices updated with software/hardware patches• Support and administer third-party applications• Ensure network security and connectivity• Monitor network performance (availability, utilization, throughput, goodput, and latency) and test for weaknesses• Set up user accounts, permissions and passwords• Resolve problems reported by end user• Define network policies and procedures• Specify system requirements and design solutions• Research and make recommendations on server system administration Requirements• Friendly and patient demeanor at all times• Ability to quickly understand companywide IT practices.• Proven experience in a network administrator role• Hands on experience in networking, routing and switching• Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure• Experience with firewalls, Internet VPN’s remote implementation, troubleshooting, and problem resolution is desired• Ability to set up and configure server hardware• Ability to set up and configure PC’s and Macs in an Active Directory structure• Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies• Demonstrated success with organizing, prioritizing and multitasking Desired Certifications • Fortinet NSE certification a plus but not required• MTA, MCSA, MCSE certifications a plus, but not required
